bibl.title: Letter, A. G. Watkins in Military Prison to O. P. Temple and John Baxter in Knoxville, Tenn., 1864 October 22
bibl.note: 1864 October 22, A.G. Watkins in Military Prison writes to O.P. Temple and Baxter in Knoxville, Tenn. Requests either or both of them to act as counsel and arrange bond for him in defense of charge of treason.

div.p: I am held in prison on a charge of Treason It is my desire to give bond & security for my appearance at Court, and to prepare for my defence. Coonsent is given by Lt. Shaw for prisoners to consult Counsel at the Marshals office upon application of Counsel to see prisoner. You will confer a favour that will be duly appreciated if either or both of you will see me at the office designated on this day or at your earliest convenience.
Letter retaining Temple & Baxter to defend him.
